page.title: 05LOCAL NEWS:THE RIPON GAZETTE
page.content: The 40th anniversary of V.E.day was celebrated with services and then wartime music and an open-air disco on the market place.Many people described their wartime memories in the papers. Different ethical standards were reflected by two headlines:One featured a Spring fair held at the town hall to aid the mayors charity, the mentally handicapped;two weeks later the headlines were neighbours' opposition to the opening of a new home for the mentally handicapped. The other main theme of letters, during the period,was whether or not the Ripon Hornblower should restrict his horn-blowing to purely "civic" affairs,or should be allowed to open galas etc.
